course_title: Hybrid Contextual Education I Site Reflection: Refugee/Immigrant Communities
class_notes: (ONLINE REFLECTION GROUP) (Permission to enroll provided by Office of Contextual Education upon approval of site contract for site which fits group theme; concurrent enrollment in any section of PC 501 required for any student who entered the MDiv program prior to Fall 2023)  (All students in Con Ed I will be required to complete additional learning modules during the course of the semester)
course_description: For Hybrid Contextual Education 1, first-year MDiv students choose a social service setting within their own area in conversation with the Office of Contextual Education. Four hours of weekly engagement at these sites during the entire academic year give students the opportunity to experience various ministries, contexts, and pastoral relationships. In the first semester, students meet weekly in their 90-minute Contextual Education I site Reflection Group led by their site supervisor. In the second semester, students continue working four hours per week at the same Contextual Education I site. Students meet with a faculty member (usually their academic adviser) and their site supervisor for a weekly, two-hour Integrative Seminar. An evaluation is made at the end of each semester and an in progress (IP) grade is assigned at the end of the first semester if the student is performing satisfactorily. To receive credit, the student must satisfactorily complete two consecutive semesters.
